Articles.Content:
I have some kind of problem with Kopernicus, please fix it somehow, you can see my installed mods etc. below.

https://imgur.com/a/j3lu5px //what ksp said (some Kopernicus exception in the loading process and missing planets)

https://imgur.com/a/Vg0F0iV //all my installed mods (in CKAN and also GameData folder)

thank you!
@Atlasik your question has been split off from the TOTM thread it was in and moved to tech support.

First of all, why are there compressed folders inside your GameData folder? Those definitely shouldn’t be there, either move them somewhere else (preferably not inside the KSP folders at all) or delete them.

Second, you have two ModuleManager .dlls which you should never have, and to me is a sign that you’ve installed a number of mods manually and not with CKAN.

I suggest you start from scratch:

  1. In CKAN go to File > export modpack and save that to your desktop;
  2. Uninstall all mods using CKAN;
  3. Remove everything else from GameData except Squad (that’s KSP itself, you need that!);
  4. Use CKAN to reinstall the modpack you saved earlier;
  5. If you want to add mods manually after that, unzip/decompress them in your downloads folder first and them copy them over to GameData. Make sure you only have one ModuleManager, the one with the highest version.

If that still doesn’t fix the problem, in the Kopernicus error there are clear instructions about what logs you should provide to get proper debugging: KSP.log and ModuleManager.configcache are inside GameData while Logs/Kopernicus is in the root KSP directory. This might help:
